history.heading: Measuring systems having all of the following:
history.title: Measuring systems having all of the following:

supplement.heading: Supplement No. 1 to Part 774 - The Commerce Control List

breadcrumbs: B. “Test”, “Inspection” and “Production Equipment”
2B006 Dimensional inspection or measuring systems, equipment, and “electronic assemblies”, as follows (see List of Items Controlled).
Linear and angular displacement measuring instruments, as follows:
‘Linear displacement’ measuring instruments having any of the following:
history.text:
Measuring systems having all of the following:
Containing a “laser;”
b.1.c.1. Containing a “laser;”
A “resolution” over their full scale of 0.200 nm or less (better); and
b.1.c.2. A “resolution” over their full scale of 0.200 nm or less (better); and
Capable of achieving a “measurement uncertainty” equal to or less (better) than (1.6 + L/2,000) nm (L is the measured length in mm) at any point within a measuring range, when compensated for the refractive index of air and measured over a period of 30 seconds at a temperature of 20±0.01 °C; or
b.1.c.3. Capable of achieving a “measurement uncertainty” equal to or less (better) than (1.6 + L/2,000) nm (L is the measured length in mm) at any point within a measuring range, when compensated for the refractive index of air and measured over a period of 30 seconds at a temperature of 20±0.01 °C; or

Containing a “laser;”
b.1.c.1. Containing a “laser;”
A “resolution” over their full scale of 0.200 nm or less (better); and
b.1.c.2. A “resolution” over their full scale of 0.200 nm or less (better); and
Capable of achieving a “measurement uncertainty” equal to or less (better) than (1.6 + L/2,000) nm (L is the measured length in mm) at any point within a measuring range, when compensated for the refractive index of air and measured over a period of 30 seconds at a temperature of 20±0.01 °C; or
b.1.c.3. Capable of achieving a “measurement uncertainty” equal to or less (better) than (1.6 + L/2,000) nm (L is the measured length in mm) at any point within a measuring range, when compensated for the refractive index of air and measured over a period of 30 seconds at a temperature of 20±0.01 °C; or
